0.Pros: Flexible HoursEasy To get a job there

1.Pros: The branch I worked at paid a dollar above minimum wage. That's it.
1.Cons: They never tell you when you're supposed to work. They post the schedule when most of their employees aren't there.

2.Pros: You can basically do whatever you'd like on the job. You work with nice people.
2.Cons: You don't get to move up. It is very hard to have upward mobility. Competition is fierce at every McDonald's .

3.Summary: "Its not bad as people say it is"
3.Pros: You make Friends ,schedule is great .You get experience. You get to interact with a variety of people.
3.Cons: When it gets busy, its hell. People are rude and mean. Pay is low

4.Pros: They are Somewhat flexible with schedule
4.Cons: Not much pay, new owners reduced starting pay to minumum wage. No reward to getting promoted, they don't pay enough to compensate for experience and the added responsibility required.Low morale

5.Cons: I did not like working there

6.Pros: Easy to get a job. You will meet great coworkers.
6.Cons: Long hours in your feet, rude people. Simply a job, not a career. It's like a place that slowly sucks your soul out.

7.Pros: Good experience i learnt alot of thing

8.Pros: Fun work environment, everything about the job was simplified as much as possible. Hours were fairly consistent as well which is important.
8.Cons: Although the hours were consistent, sometimes they were a bit strenuous depending what shift you were given. Good for part time though.

9.Pros: Lots of fun working there it is a good working place good customers I like all of my managers that I work with
